MINIDLNA.NAN: : The previous value has been kept because the value entered is not a number.
MINIDLNA.INFO_RANGE: : The previous value has been kept because the entered number is not in the valid range
MINIDLNA.DIR_MISSING: does not exist. The previous directory information has been retained.
MINIDLNA.ERR_ABSOLUTE_PATH: is not an absolute path specification. The previous path specification has been retained.
MINIDLNA.CONF_UPDATED: The MiniDLNA configuration has been updated.
MINIDLNA.RESCAN_FAILED: Failed to rescan the media directories:
MINIDLNA.AUDIO_FOLDER_DOC: Absolute path to the directory that holds the audio files. Multiple directory paths can also be specified, which must be separated by the string " // " (without the quotation marks). E.g. /mnt/USB/usbdrive/music // /home/volumio/music
MINIDLNA.PICTURE_FOLDER_DOC: Absolute path to the directory that holds the picture files. Multiple directory paths can also be specified, which must be separated by the string " // " (without the quotation marks). E.g. /mnt/USB/usbdrive/pictures // /home/volumio/pictures
MINIDLNA.VIDEO_FOLDER_DOC: Absolute path to the directory that holds the video files. Multiple directory paths can also be specified, which must be separated by the string " // " (without the quotation marks). E.g. /mnt/USB/usbdrive/videos // /home/volumio/videos
MINIDLNA.ENABLE_MERGE_MEDIA_DIRS_DOC: Merge all media directories base contents into the root container.
MINIDLNA.DB_DIR_DOC: Path to the directory that should hold the database and album art cache.
MINIDLNA.LOG_DIR_DOC: Path to the directory that should hold the log file.
MINIDLNA.ROOT_CONTAINER_DOC: Use a different container as the root of the directory tree presented to clients.
MINIDLNA.NETWORK_INTERFACE_DOC: Network interface(s) to bind to (e.g. eth0), comma delimited.
MINIDLNA.PORT_DOC: Port number for HTTP traffic (descriptions, SOAP, media transfer).
MINIDLNA.FRIENDLY_NAME_DOC: Name that the DLNA server presents to clients.
MINIDLNA.SERIAL_DOC: Serial number the server reports to clients.
MINIDLNA.MODEL_NAME_DOC: Model name the server reports to clients.
MINIDLNA.MODEL_NUMBER_DOC: Model number the server reports to clients.
MINIDLNA.INOTIFY_DOC: Automatic discovery of new files in the media directories.
MINIDLNA.ALBUM_ART_NAMES_DOC: List of file names to look for when searching for album art. Names should be delimited with a forward slash ("/").
MINIDLNA.STRICT_DLNA_DOC: Strictly adhere to DLNA standards. This allows server-side downscaling of very large JPEG images, which may decrease JPEG serving performance on some DLNA products.
MINIDLNA.ENABLE_TIVO_DOC: Support for streaming .jpg and .mp3 files to a TiVo supporting HMO.
MINIDLNA.TIVO_DISCOVERY_DOC: Select which method to use for registering in TiVo.
MINIDLNA.MINISSDPDSOCKET_DOC: Path to the MiniSSDPd socket, for MiniSSDPd support.
MINIDLNA.FORCE_SORT_CRITERIA_DOC: Always set SortCriteria to this value, regardless of the SortCriteria passed by the client. E.g. force_sort_criteria=+upnp:class,+upnp:originalTrackNumber,+dc:title
MINIDLNA.MAX_CONNECTIONS_DOC: Maximum number of simultaneous connections. NOTE: Many clients open several simultaneous connections while streaming.
MINIDLNA.LOGLEVEL_DOC: Log level "off" turns off logging entirely, "fatal" is the highest level of importance and "debug" the lowest.
MINIDLNA.ENABLE_WIDE_LINKS_DOC: Allow symlinks that point outside user-defined media directories.
MINIDLNA.RECREATE_DB_DOC: Forces a full rescan of the media files with re-creating the database. All cached data and database will be removed.
MINIDLNA.UPDATE_DB_DOC: Forces a non-destructive rescan of the media files.
